channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: 1 in 3 Pinoy micro-entrepreneurs started business during pandemic
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: One in every three Filipino micro-entrepreneurs started a business during the COVID-19 pandemic, a survey conducted by web-hosting company GoDaddy showed.

item.title: Palace: Without funds, MECQ can’t be extended
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Duterte is expected to announce on Monday the new quarantine classifications for Metro Manila and other areas, but Malacañang deemed it highly unlikely for the metropolis and nearby provinces to remain under strict lockdown.

item.title: Postponement of school opening pressed
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Bong Go has joined other senators calling on government to postpone the opening of the school year on Aug. 24 to October.

item.title: PhilHealth suspends IRM implementation
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: The Philippine Health Insurance Corp. has suspended the implementation of the controversial Interim Reimbursement Mechanism amid congressional inquiry into alleged anomalies in the agency.

item.title: Sayyaf leader surrenders, arrested in Misuari’s house
item.author: Edith Regalado
item.description: Authorities arrested last night Abu Sayyaf leader Indang Susukan at the house of Moro National Liberation Front leader Nur Misuari here.

item.title: Local PPE producers want tax exemptions
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: Local manufacturers of medical grade personal protective equipment are pushing for the passage of the Bayanihan 2 bill, which should include tax exemption for domestic sales, as well as giving priority to locally made products in government procurement.

item.title: ‘Blended learning dry run a success in 500 schools’
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The Department of Education has successfully conducted blended learning simulations in over 500 public schools nationwide as the opening of classes will proceed as scheduled on Aug. 24.

item.title: Pandemic renders new generation shell-shocked ­— ILO
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic is “inflicting multiple shocks” on the young that threatens the entire generation, making them deeply uncertain over future career prospects, according to a new report of the United Nations labor agency.

item.title: Cabinet members to act as ‘big brother’ to mayors
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Cabinet secretaries will be acting as a “big brother” to local officials to aggressively pursue the government’s National Action Plan against COVID-19, particularly in high-risk areas in Metro Manila and four adjacent provinces, Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: ‘Allot P10 billion tourism bail out for businesses’
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Cagayan de Oro City Rep. Rufus Rodriguez has appealed to the senators and congressmen who will sit in the bicameral conference committee to iron out kinks in the Bayanihan 2 bill to retain the tourism industry’s P10-billion bailout fund.
